channel.title: Rimmington Willow Chopper and Seller [SRL]
channel.description:
[U]Script information[/U] Chops the willows south east of rimmington and sells them in rimmington general store
[U]Features[/U] Fully autocolor- gets 3 colors of the tree so it finds a tree in few mouse movements
Combines fast woodcutting experiance with a small profit
Baised on SRL preachings- no endless loops, multiple players, that sort of thing
[U]Please note[/U] This is the leecher version of this script, antibans and other things are not included in this version, if you are a SRL member, go to SRL members scripts in the woodcutting section to find the real version.
[B]Please post progress reports- This is a leecher script, i dont really expect any[/B],but if you please me enough and iv had a good day, i might send you the members version
please note= the members version is on the SRL forums, this link [url=http://dakotastorm.sslpowered.com/villu-reborn.com/index.php]http://dakotastorm.sslpowered.com/villu-reborn.com/index.php[/url]
iv fixed some bugs and made version 1.1 Thanks to everyone who posted bugs

item.title: Rimmington Willow Chopper and Seller [SRL]
item.dc:creator: @Jhnboyman Jhnboyman
item.description:
@Jhnboyman wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:3, topic:14190”]the deformed bitmap finding is quite good, (WT-Fakawi’s ;D)

very often it the finds the white haired shopkeeper in 1 click

the two bitmaps are just the keeper facing south, and facing east, however, occasonally when the general store symbol moves too north, the guys moves where s/he cant see the guy, although there is a fail-safe, after 6 attempts, the clicks somewhere on the minimap.

the shopfinding works because the white-haired shopkeeper never moves, but only faces in 2 possible directions

about the colorfinding, its a nice suggestion, but in the members version, it finds the tree color using FindDeformed, it doesnt have that erratic mouse moving around.

by the way, the members script isnt acctually on mopar’s site, its on dankness’ make sure you apply at the right forum :P[/quote]

do you happen to know a link to Darknesses site?
thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Rimmington Willow Chopper and Seller [SRL]
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

the deformed bitmap finding is quite good, (WT-Fakawi’s ;D)

very often it the finds the white haired shopkeeper in 1 click

the two bitmaps are just the keeper facing south, and facing east, however, occasonally when the general store symbol moves too north, the guys moves where s/he cant see the guy, although there is a fail-safe, after 6 attempts, the clicks somewhere on the minimap.

the shopfinding works because the white-haired shopkeeper never moves, but only faces in 2 possible directions

about the colorfinding, its a nice suggestion, but in the members version, it finds the tree color using FindDeformed, it doesnt have that erratic mouse moving around.

by the way, the members script isnt acctually on mopar’s site, its on dankness’ make sure you apply at the right forum

Read full topic

item.title: Rimmington Willow Chopper and Seller [SRL]
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

I haven’t used it, since I don’t have an autoer down by rimmington with an axe, but I looked through the code and It looks nice, very nice.

I noticed your shopkeeper finding procedure, and it interested be considering I’m working on a shop opener that I’m hoping to make compatible with most common shops. Does the FindDeformed work most of the time? Cuz you only had 2 bitmaps and the shopkeeper can be turned around? Just wondering, and If I do take something from it, I’ll be sure to give you credit.

Also, I had one recommendation on the color finding, after you find the first color, you could try searching for the second color within a 50 by 50 box of the previous x, y coords, and then trying to find the 3rd color within a 30 by 30 box of the 2nd x, y coords, but just a suggestion.

Otherwise, looks like a great script, can’t wait until I finish my SRL application script so I can see your full script.

-Weibs

Read full topic
